questions.question_text:
Company A suspects an employee has been exfiltrating PII via a USB thumb drive. An analyst is tasked with attempting to locate the information on the drive. The
PII in question includes the following:
//IMG//

Which of the following would BEST accomplish the task assigned to the analyst?

discussion.content: Instead of parenthesis the answer C needs {} symbols.

comments.content: I agree. running every answer through a regex tester doesn't work but this one does.

discussion.content:
I think it should be like this:
\d{3}-\d{2}-\d{4}

questions.question_text: A recently issued audit report highlighted exceptions related to end-user handling of sensitive data and access credentials. A security manager is addressing the findings. Which of the following activities should be implemented?

discussion.content: related to end-user handling of sensitive data and access credentials. B right

the cysa book a review (security+ also) has end-users being the weakest link in security, training normaly is the right answer in the Comptia world, (remember there is the real word and the comptia world)

comments.content: valid point but the question specifically notes end user handling issues.... wording like this i took as basically telling you its training

discussion.content: Isn't deploying GPO much better to control handling of sensitive data and access credential. Increase training requirements won't do much if end-users won't change their practices

questions.question_text: An organization is requesting the development of a disaster recovery plan. The organization has grown and so has its infrastructure. Documentation, policies, and procedures do not exist. Which of the following steps should be taken to assist in the development of the disaster recovery plan?

discussion.content: In disaster recovery plan, identifying assets is the first step then comes the risk assessment.
Yep it should be D asset identification first
You need to know your assets first and then identify threats to those assets.

questions.question_text: A security analyst begins to notice the CPU utilization from a sinkhole has begun to spike. Which of the following describes what may be occurring?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
sinkhole is meant to capture and reroute traffic to the sinkhole... imagine its C

choices.D: Something is controlling the sinkhole and causing CPU spikes due to malicious utilization.
choices.A: Someone has logged on to the sinkhole and is using the device.
choices.C: The sinkhole has begun rerouting unauthorized traffic.
choices.B: The sinkhole has begun blocking suspect or malicious traffic.

questions.question_text: Alerts have been received from the SIEM, indicating infections on multiple computers. Based on threat characteristics, these files were quarantined by the host- based antivirus program. At the same time, additional alerts in the SIEM show multiple blocked URLs from the address of the infected computers; the URLs were classified as uncategorized. The domain location of the IP address of the URLs that were blocked is checked, and it is registered to an ISP in Russia. Which of the following steps should be taken NEXT?

discussion.content:
A is not an answer below are the reason
- Malware detected and remediated, If APT attack malware detection takes time and it is sophisticated and normally undetected 
- Communication is already blocked from the perimeter hence no risk associating the generated outbound request from host machines.
- URL were unclassified, there is no direct indication of Malicious 

So i Go with B
It looks that the malicious activity was detected and quarantined immediately, which, in my opinion, doesn't give a real indication of APT attack. I'd go with B

comments.content: The question said "Alerts have been received from the SIEM". But in any case, A is still better option for me

discussion.content: And what happens if you haven't got Splunk in your environment? I agree with Toyeeb. A should be the correct answer.
This looks to me like an APT. In which A is the best option here.

choices.B: Run a full antivirus scan on all computers and use Splunk to search for any suspicious activity that happened just before the alerts were received in the SIEM.
choices.D: Install a computer with the same settings as the infected computers in the DMZ to use as a honeypot. Permit the URLs classified as uncategorized to and from that host.
choices.C: Run a vulnerability scan and patch discovered vulnerabilities on the next pathing cycle. Have the users restart their computers. Create a use case in the SIEM to monitor failed logins on the infected computers.
choices.A: Remove those computers from the network and replace the hard drives. Send the infected hard drives out for investigation.
